files.name: realm.gno
README.md
files.body:
# GnoBounty

A decentralized bounty system for managing rewards on GitHub issues (or any issue tracker) using the Gno blockchain, with DAO-based validation through validator voting.

## Features

- **Create Bounties**: Post a bounty on any issue by providing the issue URL and sending GNOT tokens
- **Apply for Bounties**: Submit your merged PR link to apply for a bounty
- **DAO Validation**: 3 validators are randomly selected to vote on each application
- **Automatic Claims**: Bounties are automatically claimed when 2/3 validators approve
- **Validator System**: Decentralized validation through registered validators
- **Cancel Bounties**: Creators can cancel unclaimed bounties and receive a refund
- **List Bounties**: Browse all active bounties with reward amounts
- **Transparent**: All bounties and applications are stored on-chain and publicly viewable

## How to Use

### Creating a Bounty

To create a bounty, call the `CreateBounty` function with the issue URL and description, and send GNOT tokens:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty" \
  -func "CreateBounty" \
  -args "https://github.com/gnolang/gno/issues/1234" \
  -args "Fix the rendering bug in GRC20 token display" \
  -send "5000000ugnot" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

**Parameters:**
- `issueURL`: The URL of the issue (GitHub, GitLab, etc.)
- `description`: A brief description of what needs to be done
- `send`: The bounty amount in ugnot (1 GNOT = 1,000,000 ugnot)

**Minimum bounty**: 1 GNOT (1,000,000 ugnot)

### Viewing Bounties

Visit the realm in your browser to see all active bounties:

```
https://gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty
```

Or view a specific bounty by ID:

```
https://gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty/1
```

### Applying for a Bounty

When you complete work on a bounty, submit your merged PR link to apply:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty" \
  -func "ApplyForBounty" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "https://github.com/gnolang/gno/pull/5678" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

**Parameters:**
- First arg: Bounty ID
- Second arg: URL of your merged pull request

**What happens next:**
1. Your application is created
2. 3 random validators are selected from the validator pool
3. Validators review your PR and vote to approve or reject
4. If 2 out of 3 validators approve, the bounty is automatically transferred to you!

### Validator Voting

If you're a registered validator, you can vote on applications assigned to you:

```bash
# Approve an application
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty" \
  -func "Vote" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "true" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey

# Reject an application
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty" \
  -func "Vote" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "false" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

**Parameters:**
- First arg: Application ID
- Second arg: "true" to approve, "false" to reject

### Legacy: Manual Claiming (deprecated)

The old manual claim system is still available but deprecated in favor of DAO validation:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty" \
  -func "ClaimBounty" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "g1abc123...xyz" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

### Cancelling a Bounty

If you need to cancel a bounty and get your funds back:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty" \
  -func "CancelBounty" \
  -args "1" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

**Note:** You can only cancel bounties that haven't been claimed yet.

## API Reference

### Bounty Functions

#### `CreateBounty(cur realm, issueURL, description string) uint64`
Creates a new bounty and returns the bounty ID. Must send GNOT with the transaction.

#### `GetBounty(id uint64) *Bounty`
Returns bounty details by ID.

#### `CancelBounty(cur realm, id uint64)`
Cancels a bounty and refunds the creator. Only callable by the bounty creator on unclaimed bounties.

#### `ListBounties() string`
Returns a formatted list of all active bounties.

#### `GetBountyDetails(id uint64) string`
Returns detailed information about a specific bounty with apply button.

#### `GetBountyCount() uint64`
Returns the total number of bounties created.

### Application & Voting Functions

#### `ApplyForBounty(cur realm, bountyID uint64, prLink string) uint64`
Submit an application for a bounty with your merged PR link. Returns the application ID.
- Automatically selects 3 random validators
- Creates a pending application
- Returns application ID

#### `Vote(cur realm, applicationID uint64, approve bool)`
Vote on an application (validator only). Must be one of the selected validators.
- `approve`: true to approve, false to reject
- Automatically claims bounty if 2/3 validators approve

#### `GetApplication(id uint64) *Application`
Returns application details by ID.

#### `GetApplicationsForBounty(bountyID uint64) []*Application`
Returns all applications for a specific bounty.

#### `GetApplicationsForValidator(validatorAddr address) []*Application`
Returns all applications assigned to a validator for voting.

#### `GetApplicationCount() uint64`
Returns the total number of applications created.

### Validator Management Functions

#### `AddValidator(cur realm, validatorAddr address)`
Adds a new validator to the system (admin function).

#### `RemoveValidator(cur realm, validatorAddr address)`
Deactivates a validator (admin function).

#### `IsValidator(addr address) bool`
Checks if an address is an active validator.

#### `GetActiveValidatorCount() int`
Returns the number of active validators.

#### `ListValidators() string`
Returns a formatted list of all validators and their status.

### Rendering Functions

#### `RenderMyVotes(validatorAddr address) string`
Shows pending applications that need votes from the specified validator, with approve/reject buttons.

#### `Render(path string) string`
Main render function for the realm.

### Bounty Structure

```go
type Bounty struct {
    ID          uint64    // Unique bounty identifier
    IssueURL    string    // Link to the issue
    Description string    // Description of the work
    Amount      int64     // Reward amount in ugnot
    Creator     address   // Address of the bounty creator
    CreatedAt   time.Time // When the bounty was created
    IsClaimed   bool      // Whether the bounty has been claimed
    Claimer     address   // Address of the claimer (if claimed)
    ClaimedAt   time.Time // When the bounty was claimed
}
```

## Example Workflow

1. **Alice creates a bounty** for fixing a bug, sending 5 GNOT:
   ```
   CreateBounty("https://github.com/project/repo/issues/42", "Fix memory leak in parser")
   ```

2. **Bob sees the bounty** and decides to work on it. He visits the issue URL and starts coding.

3. **Bob completes the work** and submits a pull request fixing the issue.

4. **Alice verifies the fix** and approves Bob's claim:
   ```
   ClaimBounty(cross, 1, "g1bob123...xyz")
   ```

5. **Bob receives 5 GNOT** automatically to his address!

## Security Considerations

- Only the bounty creator can approve claims
- Bounties are locked in the realm contract until claimed or cancelled
- Once claimed, bounties cannot be cancelled
- The realm must have sufficient funds to pay out bounties

## Notes

- This implementation uses the new Gno standard library split (post-#3874)
- Amounts are stored in ugnot (micro-GNOT): 1 GNOT = 1,000,000 ugnot
- The `address` type is used as a builtin instead of `std.Address`
- Uses new imports:
  - `gno.land/r/sys/chain` for `Coin` and `Coins` types
  - `gno.land/r/sys/chain/banker` for banker operations (`NewBanker`, `BankerType*`, `OriginSend`)
  - `gno.land/r/sys/chain/runtime` for realm functions (`PreviousRealm`, `CurrentRealm`)

## License

MIT

files.name: nft.gno
README.md
files.body:
# GnoBounty

A decentralized bounty system for managing rewards on GitHub issues (or any issue tracker) using the Gno blockchain, with DAO-based validation through validator voting.

## Features

- **Create Bounties**: Post a bounty on any issue by providing the issue URL and sending GNOT tokens
- **Apply for Bounties**: Submit your merged PR link to apply for a bounty
- **DAO Validation**: 3 validators are randomly selected to vote on each application
- **Automatic Claims**: Bounties are automatically claimed when 2/3 validators approve
- **Validator System**: Decentralized validation through registered validators
- **Cancel Bounties**: Creators can cancel unclaimed bounties and receive a refund
- **List Bounties**: Browse all active bounties with reward amounts
- **Transparent**: All bounties and applications are stored on-chain and publicly viewable

## How to Use

### Creating a Bounty

To create a bounty, call the `CreateBounty` function with the issue URL and description, and send GNOT tokens:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty" \
  -func "CreateBounty" \
  -args "https://github.com/gnolang/gno/issues/1234" \
  -args "Fix the rendering bug in GRC20 token display" \
  -send "5000000ugnot" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

**Parameters:**
- `issueURL`: The URL of the issue (GitHub, GitLab, etc.)
- `description`: A brief description of what needs to be done
- `send`: The bounty amount in ugnot (1 GNOT = 1,000,000 ugnot)

**Minimum bounty**: 1 GNOT (1,000,000 ugnot)

### Viewing Bounties

Visit the realm in your browser to see all active bounties:

```
https://gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty
```

Or view a specific bounty by ID:

```
https://gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty/1
```

### Applying for a Bounty

When you complete work on a bounty, submit your merged PR link to apply:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty" \
  -func "ApplyForBounty" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "https://github.com/gnolang/gno/pull/5678" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

**Parameters:**
- First arg: Bounty ID
- Second arg: URL of your merged pull request

**What happens next:**
1. Your application is created
2. 3 random validators are selected from the validator pool
3. Validators review your PR and vote to approve or reject
4. If 2 out of 3 validators approve, the bounty is automatically transferred to you!

### Validator Voting

If you're a registered validator, you can vote on applications assigned to you:

```bash
# Approve an application
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty" \
  -func "Vote" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "true" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey

# Reject an application
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty" \
  -func "Vote" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "false" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

**Parameters:**
- First arg: Application ID
- Second arg: "true" to approve, "false" to reject

### Legacy: Manual Claiming (deprecated)

The old manual claim system is still available but deprecated in favor of DAO validation:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty" \
  -func "ClaimBounty" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "g1abc123...xyz" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

### Cancelling a Bounty

If you need to cancel a bounty and get your funds back:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty" \
  -func "CancelBounty" \
  -args "1" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

**Note:** You can only cancel bounties that haven't been claimed yet.

## API Reference

### Bounty Functions

#### `CreateBounty(cur realm, issueURL, description string) uint64`
Creates a new bounty and returns the bounty ID. Must send GNOT with the transaction.

#### `GetBounty(id uint64) *Bounty`
Returns bounty details by ID.

#### `CancelBounty(cur realm, id uint64)`
Cancels a bounty and refunds the creator. Only callable by the bounty creator on unclaimed bounties.

#### `ListBounties() string`
Returns a formatted list of all active bounties.

#### `GetBountyDetails(id uint64) string`
Returns detailed information about a specific bounty with apply button.

#### `GetBountyCount() uint64`
Returns the total number of bounties created.

### Application & Voting Functions

#### `ApplyForBounty(cur realm, bountyID uint64, prLink string) uint64`
Submit an application for a bounty with your merged PR link. Returns the application ID.
- Automatically selects 3 random validators
- Creates a pending application
- Returns application ID

#### `Vote(cur realm, applicationID uint64, approve bool)`
Vote on an application (validator only). Must be one of the selected validators.
- `approve`: true to approve, false to reject
- Automatically claims bounty if 2/3 validators approve

#### `GetApplication(id uint64) *Application`
Returns application details by ID.

#### `GetApplicationsForBounty(bountyID uint64) []*Application`
Returns all applications for a specific bounty.

#### `GetApplicationsForValidator(validatorAddr address) []*Application`
Returns all applications assigned to a validator for voting.

#### `GetApplicationCount() uint64`
Returns the total number of applications created.

### Validator Management Functions

#### `AddValidator(cur realm, validatorAddr address)`
Adds a new validator to the system (admin function).

#### `RemoveValidator(cur realm, validatorAddr address)`
Deactivates a validator (admin function).

#### `IsValidator(addr address) bool`
Checks if an address is an active validator.

#### `GetActiveValidatorCount() int`
Returns the number of active validators.

#### `ListValidators() string`
Returns a formatted list of all validators and their status.

### Rendering Functions

#### `RenderMyVotes(validatorAddr address) string`
Shows pending applications that need votes from the specified validator, with approve/reject buttons.

#### `Render(path string) string`
Main render function for the realm.

### Bounty Structure

```go
type Bounty struct {
    ID          uint64    // Unique bounty identifier
    IssueURL    string    // Link to the issue
    Description string    // Description of the work
    Amount      int64     // Reward amount in ugnot
    Creator     address   // Address of the bounty creator
    CreatedAt   time.Time // When the bounty was created
    IsClaimed   bool      // Whether the bounty has been claimed
    Claimer     address   // Address of the claimer (if claimed)
    ClaimedAt   time.Time // When the bounty was claimed
}
```

## Example Workflow

1. **Alice creates a bounty** for fixing a bug, sending 5 GNOT:
   ```
   CreateBounty("https://github.com/project/repo/issues/42", "Fix memory leak in parser")
   ```

2. **Bob sees the bounty** and decides to work on it. He visits the issue URL and starts coding.

3. **Bob completes the work** and submits a pull request fixing the issue.

4. **Alice verifies the fix** and approves Bob's claim:
   ```
   ClaimBounty(cross, 1, "g1bob123...xyz")
   ```

5. **Bob receives 5 GNOT** automatically to his address!

## Security Considerations

- Only the bounty creator can approve claims
- Bounties are locked in the realm contract until claimed or cancelled
- Once claimed, bounties cannot be cancelled
- The realm must have sufficient funds to pay out bounties

## Notes

- This implementation uses the new Gno standard library split (post-#3874)
- Amounts are stored in ugnot (micro-GNOT): 1 GNOT = 1,000,000 ugnot
- The `address` type is used as a builtin instead of `std.Address`
- Uses new imports:
  - `gno.land/r/sys/chain` for `Coin` and `Coins` types
  - `gno.land/r/sys/chain/banker` for banker operations (`NewBanker`, `BankerType*`, `OriginSend`)
  - `gno.land/r/sys/chain/runtime` for realm functions (`PreviousRealm`, `CurrentRealm`)

## License

MIT

README.md
files.body:
# GnoBounty

A decentralized bounty system for managing rewards on GitHub issues (or any issue tracker) using the Gno blockchain, with DAO-based validation through validator voting.

## Features

- **Create Bounties**: Post a bounty on any issue by providing the issue URL and sending GNOT tokens
- **Apply for Bounties**: Submit your merged PR link to apply for a bounty
- **DAO Validation**: 3 validators are randomly selected to vote on each application
- **Automatic Claims**: Bounties are automatically claimed when 2/3 validators approve
- **Validator System**: Decentralized validation through registered validators
- **Cancel Bounties**: Creators can cancel unclaimed bounties and receive a refund
- **List Bounties**: Browse all active bounties with reward amounts
- **Transparent**: All bounties and applications are stored on-chain and publicly viewable

## How to Use

### Creating a Bounty

To create a bounty, call the `CreateBounty` function with the issue URL and description, and send GNOT tokens:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty_v3" \
  -func "CreateBounty" \
  -args "https://github.com/gnolang/gno/issues/1234" \
  -args "Fix the rendering bug in GRC20 token display" \
  -send "5000000ugnot" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

**Parameters:**
- `issueURL`: The URL of the issue (GitHub, GitLab, etc.)
- `description`: A brief description of what needs to be done
- `send`: The bounty amount in ugnot (1 GNOT = 1,000,000 ugnot)

**Minimum bounty**: 1 GNOT (1,000,000 ugnot)

### Viewing Bounties

Visit the realm in your browser to see all active bounties:

```
https://gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty_v3
```

Or view a specific bounty by ID:

```
https://gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty_v3/1
```

### Applying for a Bounty

When you complete work on a bounty, submit your merged PR link to apply:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty_v3" \
  -func "ApplyForBounty" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "https://github.com/gnolang/gno/pull/5678" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

**Parameters:**
- First arg: Bounty ID
- Second arg: URL of your merged pull request

**What happens next:**
1. Your application is created
2. 3 random validators are selected from the validator pool
3. Validators review your PR and vote to approve or reject
4. If 2 out of 3 validators approve, the bounty is automatically transferred to you!

### Validator Voting

If you're a registered validator, you can vote on applications assigned to you:

```bash
# Approve an application
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty_v3" \
  -func "Vote" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "true" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey

# Reject an application
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty_v3" \
  -func "Vote" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "false" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

**Parameters:**
- First arg: Application ID
- Second arg: "true" to approve, "false" to reject

### Legacy: Manual Claiming (deprecated)

The old manual claim system is still available but deprecated in favor of DAO validation:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty_v3" \
  -func "ClaimBounty" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "g1abc123...xyz" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

### Cancelling a Bounty

If you need to cancel a bounty and get your funds back:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty_v3" \
  -func "CancelBounty" \
  -args "1" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

**Note:** You can only cancel bounties that haven't been claimed yet.

## API Reference

### Bounty Functions

#### `CreateBounty(cur realm, issueURL, description string) uint64`
Creates a new bounty and returns the bounty ID. Must send GNOT with the transaction.

#### `GetBounty(id uint64) *Bounty`
Returns bounty details by ID.

#### `CancelBounty(cur realm, id uint64)`
Cancels a bounty and refunds the creator. Only callable by the bounty creator on unclaimed bounties.

#### `ListBounties() string`
Returns a formatted list of all active bounties.

#### `GetBountyDetails(id uint64) string`
Returns detailed information about a specific bounty with apply button.

#### `GetBountyCount() uint64`
Returns the total number of bounties created.

### Application & Voting Functions

#### `ApplyForBounty(cur realm, bountyID uint64, prLink string) uint64`
Submit an application for a bounty with your merged PR link. Returns the application ID.
- Automatically selects 3 random validators
- Creates a pending application
- Returns application ID

#### `Vote(cur realm, applicationID uint64, approve bool)`
Vote on an application (validator only). Must be one of the selected validators.
- `approve`: true to approve, false to reject
- Automatically claims bounty if 2/3 validators approve

#### `GetApplication(id uint64) *Application`
Returns application details by ID.

#### `GetApplicationsForBounty(bountyID uint64) []*Application`
Returns all applications for a specific bounty.

#### `GetApplicationsForValidator(validatorAddr address) []*Application`
Returns all applications assigned to a validator for voting.

#### `GetApplicationCount() uint64`
Returns the total number of applications created.

### Validator Management Functions

#### `AddValidator(cur realm, validatorAddr address)`
Adds a new validator to the system (admin function).

#### `RemoveValidator(cur realm, validatorAddr address)`
Deactivates a validator (admin function).

#### `IsValidator(addr address) bool`
Checks if an address is an active validator.

#### `GetActiveValidatorCount() int`
Returns the number of active validators.

#### `ListValidators() string`
Returns a formatted list of all validators and their status.

### Rendering Functions

#### `RenderMyVotes(validatorAddr address) string`
Shows pending applications that need votes from the specified validator, with approve/reject buttons.

#### `Render(path string) string`
Main render function for the realm.

### Bounty Structure

```go
type Bounty struct {
    ID          uint64    // Unique bounty identifier
    IssueURL    string    // Link to the issue
    Description string    // Description of the work
    Amount      int64     // Reward amount in ugnot
    Creator     address   // Address of the bounty creator
    CreatedAt   time.Time // When the bounty was created
    IsClaimed   bool      // Whether the bounty has been claimed
    Claimer     address   // Address of the claimer (if claimed)
    ClaimedAt   time.Time // When the bounty was claimed
}
```

## Example Workflow

1. **Alice creates a bounty** for fixing a bug, sending 5 GNOT:
   ```
   CreateBounty("https://github.com/project/repo/issues/42", "Fix memory leak in parser")
   ```

2. **Bob sees the bounty** and decides to work on it. He visits the issue URL and starts coding.

3. **Bob completes the work** and submits a pull request fixing the issue.

4. **Alice verifies the fix** and approves Bob's claim:
   ```
   ClaimBounty(cross, 1, "g1bob123...xyz")
   ```

5. **Bob receives 5 GNOT** automatically to his address!

## Security Considerations

- Only the bounty creator can approve claims
- Bounties are locked in the realm contract until claimed or cancelled
- Once claimed, bounties cannot be cancelled
- The realm must have sufficient funds to pay out bounties

## Notes

- This implementation uses the new Gno standard library split (post-#3874)
- Amounts are stored in ugnot (micro-GNOT): 1 GNOT = 1,000,000 ugnot
- The `address` type is used as a builtin instead of `std.Address`
- Uses new imports:
  - `gno.land/r/sys/chain` for `Coin` and `Coins` types
  - `gno.land/r/sys/chain/banker` for banker operations (`NewBanker`, `BankerType*`, `OriginSend`)
  - `gno.land/r/sys/chain/runtime` for realm functions (`PreviousRealm`, `CurrentRealm`)

## License

MIT

files.body:
# GnopenSea - NFT Marketplace

Marketplace NFT d√©centralis√© sur Gno.land avec gouvernance DAO.

## üöÄ Comment lister votre NFT en 3 √©tapes

### √âtape 1 : Enregistrer votre collection

**Depuis votre package NFT**, appelez la fonction `Register()` :

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/[votre-username]/[votre-nft]" \
  -func "Register" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "staging" \
  votre-wallet
```

Cela enregistre votre collection dans le **Registry DAO** (statut: non v√©rifi√©).

### √âtape 2 : Approuver le marketplace

Donnez la permission au marketplace de transf√©rer vos NFTs :

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/[votre-username]/[votre-nft]" \
  -func "SetApprovalForAll" \
  -args "g1[adresse-du-marketplace]" \
  -args "true" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

### √âtape 3 : Cr√©er votre listing

Listez votre NFT √† vendre :

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "CreateListing" \
  -args "gno.land/r/[votre-username]/[votre-nft]" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "5000000" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

**Param√®tres :**
- 1er arg : Adresse de votre package NFT
- 2√®me arg : Token ID √† vendre
- 3√®me arg : Prix en ugnot (5000000 = 5 GNOT)

---

## üõí Acheter un NFT

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "BuyNFT" \
  -args "1" \
  -send "5000000ugnot" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

---

## üìã G√©rer vos listings

### Modifier le prix

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "UpdatePrice" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "10000000" \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

### Annuler un listing

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "CancelListing" \
  -args "1" \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

---

## üé® Faire v√©rifier votre collection (badge v√©rifi√©)

### 1. Cr√©er une proposal au Registry DAO

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4" \
  -func "ProposeVerifyCollection" \
  -args "g1[adresse-de-votre-nft]" \
  -args "Nom de la collection" \
  -args "Raison de la v√©rification" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

### 2. Les membres du DAO votent

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4" \
  -func "VoteRegistry" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "yes" \
  -broadcast \
  membre-dao-wallet
```

### 3. Ex√©cuter la proposal (apr√®s quorum)

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4" \
  -func "TallyRegistryProposal" \
  -args "1" \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

---

## üí∞ Distribution des paiements

Exemple avec frais marketplace 2.5% et royalties 10% :

```
Prix de vente : 100 GNOT
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Frais marketplace (2.5%) : 2.5 GNOT
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Royalties cr√©ateur (10%) : 10 GNOT
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendeur re√ßoit : 87.5 GNOT
```

---

## üèõÔ∏è Gouvernance DAO

Le marketplace est gouvern√© par un DAO. Les membres peuvent cr√©er des proposals pour :

- ‚úÖ Approuver/retirer des collections
- ‚úÖ Modifier les frais du marketplace
- ‚úÖ Retirer des fonds du tr√©sor
- ‚úÖ Annuler un listing probl√©matique

### Cr√©er une proposal (exemple: modifier les frais)

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "ProposeUpdateFees" \
  -args "300" \
  -args "R√©duction des frais √† 3%" \
  -broadcast \
  membre-dao-wallet
```

### Voter sur une proposal

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "Vote" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "yes" \
  -broadcast \
  membre-dao-wallet
```

---

## üîß Configuration NFT minimale

Votre package NFT doit avoir une fonction `Register()` :

```go
package mynft

import (
    "gno.land/p/demo/tokens/grc721"
    "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4"
)

var (
    nft         *grc721.basicNFT
    myRealmAddr = runtime.CurrentRealm().Address()
)

func init() {
    nft = grc721.NewBasicNFT("My Collection", "MC")
}

// Register dans le registry
func Register(_ realm) {
    daoregistry4.RegisterCollection(
        myRealmAddr,
        "My Collection",
        "MC",
        "art",
        "Description de ma collection",
        "https://mon-site.com",
        false,
        nft.Getter(),
    )
}

// Fonction obligatoire pour le marketplace
func Getter() grc721.NFTGetter {
    return nft.Getter()
}
```

---

## üìä Fonctions de lecture

```bash
# Voir tous les listings actifs
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao:

# Statistiques du marketplace
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao:stats

# D√©tails d'un listing
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao:listing/1

# Collections enregistr√©es
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4:
```

---

## üîê S√©curit√©

- ‚úÖ V√©rification de propri√©t√© avant listing
- ‚úÖ V√©rification d'approbation avant vente
- ‚úÖ Transferts atomiques
- ‚úÖ Remboursement automatique des surplus
- ‚úÖ Limites de frais (max 10%)
- ‚úÖ Gouvernance d√©centralis√©e

---

## üÜò Probl√®mes courants

**"Collection not registered"**
‚Üí Vous devez d'abord appeler `Register()` sur votre NFT

**"Insufficient payment"**
‚Üí Le montant envoy√© doit correspondre au prix du listing

**"Not approved"**
‚Üí Appelez `SetApprovalForAll()` avant de cr√©er un listing

**"Not owner"**
‚Üí Seul le propri√©taire du NFT peut le lister

}

files.name: voting.gno
README.md
files.body:
# My NFT Collection - NFT avec Image Fixe

Package NFT avec **image fixe** d√©finie dans le code : tous les NFTs de cette collection partagent la m√™me image.

## ‚ú® Fonctionnalit√©s

- ‚úÖ Support de m√©tadonn√©es onchain (GRC721Metadata)
- ‚úÖ **Image fixe** d√©finie dans le code (tous les NFTs ont la m√™me apparence)
- ‚úÖ Nom et description personnalis√©s par NFT
- ‚úÖ Attributs/traits personnalis√©s (optionnel)
- ‚úÖ Compatible avec GnopenSea marketplace

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è Configuration de l'Image

**AVANT de d√©ployer**, change l'URL de l'image dans [nft.gno](nft.gno#L18) :

```go
var (
    // ...
    // CHANGE TON URL ICI ‚Üì
    collectionImageURL = "https://i.imgur.com/VOTRE_IMAGE.jpg"
)
```

### Comment obtenir une URL d'image :

1. **Imgur** (recommand√© pour tester) :
   - Va sur [imgur.com](https://imgur.com)
   - Upload ton image
   - Clique droit ‚Üí "Copy image address"
   - Colle l'URL dans `collectionImageURL`

2. **IPFS** (d√©centralis√©) :
   - Upload via [Pinata](https://pinata.cloud) ou [NFT.Storage](https://nft.storage)
   - Utilise : `https://ipfs.io/ipfs/QmVotreCID/image.png`

---

## üöÄ D√©ploiement

```bash
gnokey maketx addpkg \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/mynftcollection" \
  -pkgdir "./community/packages/r/pierre115/my_nft_collection" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 100000000 \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "staging" \
  -remote "https://rpc.gno.land:443" \
  votre-wallet
```

---

## üìù Utilisation

### 1. Enregistrer la collection dans le Registry DAO

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/mynftcollection" \
  -func "Register" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "staging" \
  -remote "https://rpc.gno.land:443" \
  votre-wallet
```

### 2. Mint un NFT

#### **Option A : NFT Simple (nom + description)**

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/mynftcollection" \
  -func "MintNFT" \
  -args "Cosmic Cat #1" \
  -args "A mystical cat floating in space" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "staging" \
  votre-wallet
```

**R√©sultat** : NFT avec :
- Image : celle d√©finie dans `collectionImageURL`
- Nom : "Cosmic Cat #1"
- Description : "A mystical cat floating in space"

#### **Option B : NFT avec Attributs** (ex: jeu, collection rare)

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/mynftcollection" \
  -func "MintNFTWithAttributes" \
  -args "Epic Sword #42" \
  -args "Legendary weapon forged in dragon fire" \
  -args '["Rarity","Power","Element"]' \
  -args '["Legendary","95","Fire"]' \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

**R√©sultat** : NFT avec :
- Image : celle d√©finie dans `collectionImageURL`
- Nom : "Epic Sword #42"
- Attributs :
  - **Rarity**: Legendary
  - **Power**: 95
  - **Element**: Fire

### 3. Voir les m√©tadonn√©es d'un NFT

```bash
# Via render
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/mynftcollection:1

# Via fonction
gnokey query vm/qeval \
  -remote "https://rpc.gno.land:443" \
  -data "gno.land/r/pierre115/mynftcollection
GetTokenMetadata(\"1\")"
```

### 4. Approuver le marketplace

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/mynftcollection" \
  -func "SetApprovalForAll" \
  -args "g1[adresse-marketplace]" \
  -args "true" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

---

## üìä Structure de M√©tadonn√©es

Tous les NFTs ont la structure suivante :

```go
Metadata {
    Name:        "Nom personnalis√© par mint",
    Description: "Description personnalis√©e par mint",
    Image:       "https://i.imgur.com/VOTRE_IMAGE.jpg", // ‚Üê FIXE pour tous
    Attributes:  [
        { TraitType: "Rarity",  Value: "Legendary" }, // Optionnel
        { TraitType: "Power",   Value: "95" },
        // ...
    ]
}
```

**Important** : L'image est identique pour tous les NFTs, seuls le nom, la description et les attributs changent.

---

## üîç Fonctions Disponibles

| Fonction | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `Register()` | Enregistrer la collection dans le registry |
| `MintNFT(name, desc)` | Mint NFT simple (pas besoin de passer l'URL d'image) |
| `MintNFTWithAttributes(name, desc, traits, values)` | Mint NFT avec attributs personnalis√©s |
| `GetTokenMetadata(tokenId)` | Voir les m√©tadonn√©es d'un NFT |
| `SetApprovalForAll(operator, approved)` | Approuver un op√©rateur |
| `Getter()` | Obtenir le NFTGetter (pour marketplace) |
| `GetCollectionInfo()` | Informations sur la collection |

---

## üéØ Cas d'Usage

### Collection de Tickets / Memberships

Tous les membres ont le m√™me badge visuel :

```bash
# Tous auront la m√™me image (logo du club)
MintNFT("Member #1", "Gold Member")
MintNFT("Member #2", "Silver Member")
MintNFT("Member #3", "Gold Member")
```

### Collection de Jeu avec Stats Variables

M√™me apparence mais stats diff√©rentes :

```bash
MintNFTWithAttributes(
  "Warrior #1",
  "Strong warrior",
  ["Attack", "Defense", "Speed"],
  ["100", "50", "75"]
)

MintNFTWithAttributes(
  "Warrior #2",
  "Fast warrior",
  ["Attack", "Defense", "Speed"],
  ["80", "40", "95"]
)
```

Tous les Warriors ont la m√™me image, mais des stats diff√©rentes !

---

## üîó Int√©gration avec GnopenSea

Une fois d√©ploy√© et enregistr√© :
1. Tous les NFTs de cette collection afficheront **la m√™me image** sur le marketplace
2. Les noms et descriptions seront affich√©s dans la carte NFT
3. Les attributs seront visibles sur la page de d√©tail

---

## üí° Pourquoi une Image Fixe ?

‚úÖ **Avantages** :
- Plus simple √† mint (pas besoin de passer l'URL √† chaque fois)
- Parfait pour les collections de "tickets" ou "memberships"
- Id√©al pour les jeux o√π l'apparence est fixe mais les stats varient
- Moins cher en gas (pas besoin de stocker l'URL √† chaque mint)

‚ùå **D√©savantage** :
- Tous les NFTs ont la m√™me apparence visuelle
- Pas adapt√© pour collections d'art avec pi√®ces uniques

**Pour des images diff√©rentes par NFT**, utilise plut√¥t le package `my_test_nft` avec imageURL en param√®tre.

---

## üìÑ License

Projet de stage - Tous droits r√©serv√©s

files.name: realm.gno
README.md
files.body:
# GnopenSea - NFT Marketplace

Marketplace NFT d√©centralis√© sur Gno.land avec gouvernance DAO.

## üöÄ Comment lister votre NFT en 3 √©tapes

### √âtape 1 : Enregistrer votre collection

**Depuis votre package NFT**, appelez la fonction `Register()` :

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/[votre-username]/[votre-nft]" \
  -func "Register" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "staging" \
  votre-wallet
```

Cela enregistre votre collection dans le **Registry DAO** (statut: non v√©rifi√©).

### √âtape 2 : Approuver le marketplace

Donnez la permission au marketplace de transf√©rer vos NFTs :

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/[votre-username]/[votre-nft]" \
  -func "SetApprovalForAll" \
  -args "g1[adresse-du-marketplace]" \
  -args "true" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

### √âtape 3 : Cr√©er votre listing

Listez votre NFT √† vendre :

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "CreateListing" \
  -args "gno.land/r/[votre-username]/[votre-nft]" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "5000000" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

**Param√®tres :**
- 1er arg : Adresse de votre package NFT
- 2√®me arg : Token ID √† vendre
- 3√®me arg : Prix en ugnot (5000000 = 5 GNOT)

---

## üõí Acheter un NFT

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "BuyNFT" \
  -args "1" \
  -send "5000000ugnot" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

---

## üìã G√©rer vos listings

### Modifier le prix

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "UpdatePrice" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "10000000" \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

### Annuler un listing

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "CancelListing" \
  -args "1" \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

---

## üé® Faire v√©rifier votre collection (badge v√©rifi√©)

### 1. Cr√©er une proposal au Registry DAO

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4" \
  -func "ProposeVerifyCollection" \
  -args "g1[adresse-de-votre-nft]" \
  -args "Nom de la collection" \
  -args "Raison de la v√©rification" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

### 2. Les membres du DAO votent

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4" \
  -func "VoteRegistry" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "yes" \
  -broadcast \
  membre-dao-wallet
```

### 3. Ex√©cuter la proposal (apr√®s quorum)

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4" \
  -func "TallyRegistryProposal" \
  -args "1" \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

---

## üí∞ Distribution des paiements

Exemple avec frais marketplace 2.5% et royalties 10% :

```
Prix de vente : 100 GNOT
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Frais marketplace (2.5%) : 2.5 GNOT
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Royalties cr√©ateur (10%) : 10 GNOT
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendeur re√ßoit : 87.5 GNOT
```

---

## üèõÔ∏è Gouvernance DAO

Le marketplace est gouvern√© par un DAO. Les membres peuvent cr√©er des proposals pour :

- ‚úÖ Approuver/retirer des collections
- ‚úÖ Modifier les frais du marketplace
- ‚úÖ Retirer des fonds du tr√©sor
- ‚úÖ Annuler un listing probl√©matique

### Cr√©er une proposal (exemple: modifier les frais)

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "ProposeUpdateFees" \
  -args "300" \
  -args "R√©duction des frais √† 3%" \
  -broadcast \
  membre-dao-wallet
```

### Voter sur une proposal

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "Vote" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "yes" \
  -broadcast \
  membre-dao-wallet
```

---

## üîß Configuration NFT minimale

Votre package NFT doit avoir une fonction `Register()` :

```go
package mynft

import (
    "gno.land/p/demo/tokens/grc721"
    "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4"
)

var (
    nft         *grc721.basicNFT
    myRealmAddr = runtime.CurrentRealm().Address()
)

func init() {
    nft = grc721.NewBasicNFT("My Collection", "MC")
}

// Register dans le registry
func Register(_ realm) {
    daoregistry4.RegisterCollection(
        myRealmAddr,
        "My Collection",
        "MC",
        "art",
        "Description de ma collection",
        "https://mon-site.com",
        false,
        nft.Getter(),
    )
}

// Fonction obligatoire pour le marketplace
func Getter() grc721.NFTGetter {
    return nft.Getter()
}
```

---

## üìä Fonctions de lecture

```bash
# Voir tous les listings actifs
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao:

# Statistiques du marketplace
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao:stats

# D√©tails d'un listing
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao:listing/1

# Collections enregistr√©es
```

files.name: voting.gno
README.md
files.body:
# My NFT Collection - NFT avec Image Fixe

Package NFT avec **image fixe** d√©finie dans le code : tous les NFTs de cette collection partagent la m√™me image.

## ‚ú® Fonctionnalit√©s

- ‚úÖ Support de m√©tadonn√©es onchain (GRC721Metadata)
- ‚úÖ **Image fixe** d√©finie dans le code (tous les NFTs ont la m√™me apparence)
- ‚úÖ Nom et description personnalis√©s par NFT
- ‚úÖ Attributs/traits personnalis√©s (optionnel)
- ‚úÖ Compatible avec GnopenSea marketplace

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è Configuration de l'Image

**AVANT de d√©ployer**, change l'URL de l'image dans [nft.gno](nft.gno#L18) :

```go
var (
    // ...
    // CHANGE TON URL ICI ‚Üì
    collectionImageURL = "https://i.imgur.com/VOTRE_IMAGE.jpg"
)
```

### Comment obtenir une URL d'image :

1. **Imgur** (recommand√© pour tester) :
   - Va sur [imgur.com](https://imgur.com)
   - Upload ton image
   - Clique droit ‚Üí "Copy image address"
   - Colle l'URL dans `collectionImageURL`

2. **IPFS** (d√©centralis√©) :
   - Upload via [Pinata](https://pinata.cloud) ou [NFT.Storage](https://nft.storage)
   - Utilise : `https://ipfs.io/ipfs/QmVotreCID/image.png`

---

## üöÄ D√©ploiement

```bash
gnokey maketx addpkg \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/mynftcollection" \
  -pkgdir "./community/packages/r/pierre115/my_nft_collection" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 100000000 \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "staging" \
  -remote "https://rpc.gno.land:443" \
  votre-wallet
```

---

## üìù Utilisation

### 1. Enregistrer la collection dans le Registry DAO

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/mynftcollection" \
  -func "Register" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "staging" \
  -remote "https://rpc.gno.land:443" \
  votre-wallet
```

### 2. Mint un NFT

#### **Option A : NFT Simple (nom + description)**

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/mynftcollection" \
  -func "MintNFT" \
  -args "Cosmic Cat #1" \
  -args "A mystical cat floating in space" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "staging" \
  votre-wallet
```

**R√©sultat** : NFT avec :
- Image : celle d√©finie dans `collectionImageURL`
- Nom : "Cosmic Cat #1"
- Description : "A mystical cat floating in space"

#### **Option B : NFT avec Attributs** (ex: jeu, collection rare)

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/mynftcollection" \
  -func "MintNFTWithAttributes" \
  -args "Epic Sword #42" \
  -args "Legendary weapon forged in dragon fire" \
  -args '["Rarity","Power","Element"]' \
  -args '["Legendary","95","Fire"]' \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

**R√©sultat** : NFT avec :
- Image : celle d√©finie dans `collectionImageURL`
- Nom : "Epic Sword #42"
- Attributs :
  - **Rarity**: Legendary
  - **Power**: 95
  - **Element**: Fire

### 3. Voir les m√©tadonn√©es d'un NFT

```bash
# Via render
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/mynftcollection:1

# Via fonction
gnokey query vm/qeval \
  -remote "https://rpc.gno.land:443" \
  -data "gno.land/r/pierre115/mynftcollection
GetTokenMetadata(\"1\")"
```

### 4. Approuver le marketplace

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/mynftcollection" \
  -func "SetApprovalForAll" \
  -args "g1[adresse-marketplace]" \
  -args "true" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

---

## üìä Structure de M√©tadonn√©es

Tous les NFTs ont la structure suivante :

```go
Metadata {
    Name:        "Nom personnalis√© par mint",
    Description: "Description personnalis√©e par mint",
    Image:       "https://i.imgur.com/VOTRE_IMAGE.jpg", // ‚Üê FIXE pour tous
    Attributes:  [
        { TraitType: "Rarity",  Value: "Legendary" }, // Optionnel
        { TraitType: "Power",   Value: "95" },
        // ...
    ]
}
```

**Important** : L'image est identique pour tous les NFTs, seuls le nom, la description et les attributs changent.

---

## üîç Fonctions Disponibles

| Fonction | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `Register()` | Enregistrer la collection dans le registry |
| `MintNFT(name, desc)` | Mint NFT simple (pas besoin de passer l'URL d'image) |
| `MintNFTWithAttributes(name, desc, traits, values)` | Mint NFT avec attributs personnalis√©s |
| `GetTokenMetadata(tokenId)` | Voir les m√©tadonn√©es d'un NFT |
| `SetApprovalForAll(operator, approved)` | Approuver un op√©rateur |
| `Getter()` | Obtenir le NFTGetter (pour marketplace) |
| `GetCollectionInfo()` | Informations sur la collection |

---

## üéØ Cas d'Usage

### Collection de Tickets / Memberships

Tous les membres ont le m√™me badge visuel :

```bash
# Tous auront la m√™me image (logo du club)
MintNFT("Member #1", "Gold Member")
MintNFT("Member #2", "Silver Member")
MintNFT("Member #3", "Gold Member")
```

### Collection de Jeu avec Stats Variables

M√™me apparence mais stats diff√©rentes :

```bash
MintNFTWithAttributes(
  "Warrior #1",
  "Strong warrior",
  ["Attack", "Defense", "Speed"],
  ["100", "50", "75"]
)

MintNFTWithAttributes(
  "Warrior #2",
  "Fast warrior",
  ["Attack", "Defense", "Speed"],
  ["80", "40", "95"]
)
```

Tous les Warriors ont la m√™me image, mais des stats diff√©rentes !

---

## üîó Int√©gration avec GnopenSea

Une fois d√©ploy√© et enregistr√© :
1. Tous les NFTs de cette collection afficheront **la m√™me image** sur le marketplace
2. Les noms et descriptions seront affich√©s dans la carte NFT
3. Les attributs seront visibles sur la page de d√©tail

---

## üí° Pourquoi une Image Fixe ?

‚úÖ **Avantages** :
- Plus simple √† mint (pas besoin de passer l'URL √† chaque fois)
- Parfait pour les collections de "tickets" ou "memberships"
- Id√©al pour les jeux o√π l'apparence est fixe mais les stats varient
- Moins cher en gas (pas besoin de stocker l'URL √† chaque mint)

‚ùå **D√©savantage** :
- Tous les NFTs ont la m√™me apparence visuelle
- Pas adapt√© pour collections d'art avec pi√®ces uniques

**Pour des images diff√©rentes par NFT**, utilise plut√¥t le package `my_test_nft` avec imageURL en param√®tre.

---

## üìÑ License

Projet de stage - Tous droits r√©serv√©s

README.md
files.body:
# GnopenSea - NFT Marketplace

Marketplace NFT d√©centralis√© sur Gno.land avec gouvernance DAO.

## üöÄ Comment lister votre NFT en 3 √©tapes

### √âtape 1 : Enregistrer votre collection

**Depuis votre package NFT**, appelez la fonction `Register()` :

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/[votre-username]/[votre-nft]" \
  -func "Register" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "staging" \
  votre-wallet
```

Cela enregistre votre collection dans le **Registry DAO** (statut: non v√©rifi√©).

### √âtape 2 : Approuver le marketplace

Donnez la permission au marketplace de transf√©rer vos NFTs :

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/[votre-username]/[votre-nft]" \
  -func "SetApprovalForAll" \
  -args "g1[adresse-du-marketplace]" \
  -args "true" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

### √âtape 3 : Cr√©er votre listing

Listez votre NFT √† vendre :

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "CreateListing" \
  -args "gno.land/r/[votre-username]/[votre-nft]" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "5000000" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

**Param√®tres :**
- 1er arg : Adresse de votre package NFT
- 2√®me arg : Token ID √† vendre
- 3√®me arg : Prix en ugnot (5000000 = 5 GNOT)

---

## üõí Acheter un NFT

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "BuyNFT" \
  -args "1" \
  -send "5000000ugnot" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

---

## üìã G√©rer vos listings

### Modifier le prix

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "UpdatePrice" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "10000000" \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

### Annuler un listing

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "CancelListing" \
  -args "1" \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

---

## üé® Faire v√©rifier votre collection (badge v√©rifi√©)

### 1. Cr√©er une proposal au Registry DAO

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4" \
  -func "ProposeVerifyCollection" \
  -args "g1[adresse-de-votre-nft]" \
  -args "Nom de la collection" \
  -args "Raison de la v√©rification" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

### 2. Les membres du DAO votent

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4" \
  -func "VoteRegistry" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "yes" \
  -broadcast \
  membre-dao-wallet
```

### 3. Ex√©cuter la proposal (apr√®s quorum)

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4" \
  -func "TallyRegistryProposal" \
  -args "1" \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

---

## üí∞ Distribution des paiements

Exemple avec frais marketplace 2.5% et royalties 10% :

```
Prix de vente : 100 GNOT
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Frais marketplace (2.5%) : 2.5 GNOT
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Royalties cr√©ateur (10%) : 10 GNOT
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendeur re√ßoit : 87.5 GNOT
```

---

## üèõÔ∏è Gouvernance DAO

Le marketplace est gouvern√© par un DAO. Les membres peuvent cr√©er des proposals pour :

- ‚úÖ Approuver/retirer des collections
- ‚úÖ Modifier les frais du marketplace
- ‚úÖ Retirer des fonds du tr√©sor
- ‚úÖ Annuler un listing probl√©matique

### Cr√©er une proposal (exemple: modifier les frais)

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "ProposeUpdateFees" \
  -args "300" \
  -args "R√©duction des frais √† 3%" \
  -broadcast \
  membre-dao-wallet
```

### Voter sur une proposal

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "Vote" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "yes" \
  -broadcast \
  membre-dao-wallet
```

---

## üîß Configuration NFT minimale

Votre package NFT doit avoir une fonction `Register()` :

```go
package mynft

import (
    "gno.land/p/demo/tokens/grc721"
    "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4"
)

var (
    nft         *grc721.basicNFT
    myRealmAddr = runtime.CurrentRealm().Address()
)

func init() {
    nft = grc721.NewBasicNFT("My Collection", "MC")
}

// Register dans le registry
func Register(_ realm) {
    daoregistry4.RegisterCollection(
        myRealmAddr,
        "My Collection",
        "MC",
        "art",
        "Description de ma collection",
        "https://mon-site.com",
        false,
        nft.Getter(),
    )
}

// Fonction obligatoire pour le marketplace
func Getter() grc721.NFTGetter {
    return nft.Getter()
}
```

---

## üìä Fonctions de lecture

```bash
# Voir tous les listings actifs
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao:

# Statistiques du marketplace
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao:stats

# D√©tails d'un listing
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao:listing/1

# Collections enregistr√©es
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4:
```

---

## üîê S√©curit√©

- ‚úÖ V√©rification de propri√©t√© avant listing
- ‚úÖ V√©rification d'approbation avant vente
- ‚úÖ Transferts atomiques
- ‚úÖ Remboursement automatique des surplus
- ‚úÖ Limites de frais (max 10%)
- ‚úÖ Gouvernance d√©centralis√©e

---

## üÜò Probl√®mes courants

**"Collection not registered"**
‚Üí Vous devez d'abord appeler `Register()` sur votre NFT

**"Insufficient payment"**
‚Üí Le montant envoy√© doit correspondre au prix du listing

**"Not approved"**
‚Üí Appelez `SetApprovalForAll()` avant de cr√©er un listing

**"Not owner"**
‚Üí Seul le propri√©taire du NFT peut le lister

This is the place to ask any questions related to the CommonDAO package, like usage, possible improvements
and ideas, or relevant DAO topics.

If you're looking to learn how to use it a good starting point are the tutorials:

README.md
files.body:
# Ternary package

Ternary operator are notoriously absent from Go.
We don't advocate for their use, but hey, it's a free country.

## Usage

```go
import ternary "p/grepsuzette001/ternary/v1"

print(ternary.String(rsi>70, "SELL", "HODL"))
print(ternary.Float32(isEarly, "hi", "bye"))

// lazy functions (note the trailing "F" as in StringF):
func genWithPasses(int) string { ... }
hash := ternary.StringF(secure, genWithPasses(40), genWithPasses(1))
```

## List of functions

* func String(cond bool, yes, no string) string
* func Int(cond bool, yes, no int) int
* func Int8(cond bool, yes, no int8) int8 
* func Int16(cond bool, yes, no int16) int16 
* func Int32(cond bool, yes, no int32) int32 
* func Int64(cond bool, yes, no int64) int64 
* func Uint(cond bool, yes, no uint) uint 
* func Uint8(cond bool, yes, no uint8) uint8 
* func Uint16(cond bool, yes, no uint16) uint16 
* func Uint32(cond bool, yes, no uint32) uint32 
* func Uint64(cond bool, yes, no uint64) uint64 
* func Float32(cond bool, yes, no float32) float32 
* func Float64(cond bool, yes, no float64) float64 
* func Rune(cond bool, yes, no rune) rune 
* func Bool(cond bool, yes, no bool) rune 
* func Address(cond bool, address, address) address

There are also lazy versions, for instance:

* func StringF(cond bool, yes, no func()string) string

package ternary

import "testing"
import "gno.land/p/nt/uassert"

func TestTernaryLazy(t *testing.T) {
	uassert.Equal(t, StringF(true, func() string { return "a" }, func() string { return "b" }), "a")
	uassert.Equal(t, StringF(false, func() string { return "a" }, func() string { return "b" }), "b")
	uassert.Equal(t, IntF(true, func() int { return 0 }, func() int { return 1 }), 0)
	uassert.Equal(t, IntF(false, func() int { return 0 }, func() int { return 1 }), 1)
	uassert.Equal(t, Int8F(true, func() int8 { return 0 }, func() int8 { return 1 }), int8(0))
	uassert.Equal(t, Int8F(false, func() int8 { return 0 }, func() int8 { return 1 }), int8(1))
	uassert.Equal(t, Int16F(true, func() int16 { return 0 }, func() int16 { return 1 }), int16(0))
	uassert.Equal(t, Int16F(false, func() int16 { return 0 }, func() int16 { return 1 }), int16(1))
	uassert.Equal(t, Int32F(true, func() int32 { return 0 }, func() int32 { return 1 }), int32(0))
	uassert.Equal(t, Int32F(false, func() int32 { return 0 }, func() int32 { return 1 }), int32(1))
	uassert.Equal(t, Int64F(true, func() int64 { return 0 }, func() int64 { return 1 }), int64(0))
	uassert.Equal(t, Int64F(false, func() int64 { return 0 }, func() int64 { return 1 }), int64(1))
	uassert.Equal(t, UintF(true, func() uint { return 0 }, func() uint { return 1 }), uint(0))
	uassert.Equal(t, UintF(false, func() uint { return 0 }, func() uint { return 1 }), uint(1))
	uassert.Equal(t, Uint8F(true, func() uint8 { return 0 }, func() uint8 { return 1 }), uint8(0))
	uassert.Equal(t, Uint8F(false, func() uint8 { return 0 }, func() uint8 { return 1 }), uint8(1))
	uassert.Equal(t, Uint16F(true, func() uint16 { return 0 }, func() uint16 { return 1 }), uint16(0))
	uassert.Equal(t, Uint16F(false, func() uint16 { return 0 }, func() uint16 { return 1 }), uint16(1))
	uassert.Equal(t, Uint32F(true, func() uint32 { return 0 }, func() uint32 { return 1 }), uint32(0))
	uassert.Equal(t, Uint32F(false, func() uint32 { return 0 }, func() uint32 { return 1 }), uint32(1))
	uassert.Equal(t, Uint64F(true, func() uint64 { return 0 }, func() uint64 { return 1 }), uint64(0))
	uassert.Equal(t, Uint64F(false, func() uint64 { return 0 }, func() uint64 { return 1 }), uint64(1))
	uassert.Equal(t, Float32F(true, func() float32 { return 3.14 }, func() float32 { return 1.618 }), float32(3.14))
	uassert.Equal(t, Float32F(false, func() float32 { return 3.14 }, func() float32 { return 1.618 }), float32(1.618))
	uassert.Equal(t, Float64F(true, func() float64 { return 3.14 }, func() float64 { return 1.618 }), float64(3.14))
	uassert.Equal(t, Float64F(false, func() float64 { return 3.14 }, func() float64 { return 1.618 }), float64(1.618))
	uassert.Equal(t, RuneF(true, func() rune { return 'ÊòØ' }, func() rune { return 'Âê¶' }), 'ÊòØ')
	uassert.Equal(t, RuneF(false, func() rune { return 'ÊòØ' }, func() rune { return 'Âê¶' }), 'Âê¶')
	uassert.True(t, AddressF(true, func() address { return address("left") }, func() address { return address("right") }) == address("left"))
	uassert.True(t, AddressF(false, func() address { return address("left") }, func() address { return address("right") }) == address("right"))
}

package ternary

import (
	"testing"
)

func TestTernary(t *testing.T) {
	assert(t, String(true, "a", "b") == "a")
	assert(t, String(false, "a", "b") == "b")
	assert(t, Int(true, 0, 1) == 0)
	assert(t, Int(false, 0, 1) == 1)
	assert(t, Int8(true, 0, 1) == 0)
	assert(t, Int8(false, 0, 1) == 1)
	assert(t, Int16(true, 0, 1) == 0)
	assert(t, Int16(false, 0, 1) == 1)
	assert(t, Int32(true, 0, 1) == 0)
	assert(t, Int32(false, 0, 1) == 1)
	assert(t, Int64(true, 0, 1) == 0)
	assert(t, Int64(false, 0, 1) == 1)
	assert(t, Uint(true, 0, 1) == 0)
	assert(t, Uint(false, 0, 1) == 1)
	assert(t, Uint8(true, 0, 1) == 0)
	assert(t, Uint8(false, 0, 1) == 1)
	assert(t, Uint16(true, 0, 1) == 0)
	assert(t, Uint16(false, 0, 1) == 1)
	assert(t, Uint32(true, 0, 1) == 0)
	assert(t, Uint32(false, 0, 1) == 1)
	assert(t, Uint64(true, 0, 1) == 0)
	assert(t, Uint64(false, 0, 1) == 1)
	assert(t, Float32(true, 3.14, 1.618) == 3.14)
	assert(t, Float32(false, 3.14, 1.618) == 1.618)
	assert(t, Float64(true, 3.14, 1.618) == 3.14)
	assert(t, Float64(false, 3.14, 1.618) == 1.618)
	assert(t, Rune(true, 'ÊòØ', 'Âê¶') == 'ÊòØ')
	assert(t, Rune(false, 'ÊòØ', 'Âê¶') == 'Âê¶')
	n := 17
	assert(t, !Bool(true, n%2 == 0, n < 10))
	assert(t, Address(true, address("g0"), address("g1")).String() == "g0")
	assert(t, Address(false, address("g0"), address("g1")).String() == "g1")
}

func assert(t *testing.T, val bool) {
	t.Helper()
	if !val {
		t.Errorf("expected true, got false")
	}
}

# Player VS CPU tic-tac-toe

* Human VS CPU
* aims to start experimenting with lowtech UI
* stateless
* no wallet required

Reusing moul's tic-tac-toe logic.


```
     (‚àñ           Thanks for the wing!
    (  ‚àñ  /(o)‚àñ    Thanks for the wing!  
    (   ‚àñ/  ()/ /)  Raaarch!  *Whistle*
     (   Àà;.))Àà".) 
      Àà(/////.-Àà
   =====))=))===() 
     ///Àà       
    //   PjP/ejm
   Àà            
```
## Principle

* `path` for Render is like `board=-X---O---&move=a2`
* no javascript,
* only gnoweb markdown.

## How the hell did Cap'n Cluck learn to play?

I, Cap'n Cluck, had to learn from the most cunning and crafty of creatures ‚Äì humans! I observed those barnacle-brained bilge-rats engaged in their most awesome game o' strategies, tic-tac-toe.

Through earhole-peepin', I picked up the patterns and strategies. I honed me beak on pieces o' eight, developin' a near-nautical sense o' spatial relationships! Aarrr, soon enough, I, Cap'n Cluck, became a veritable menace, matchin' wits with any landlubber brave enough to engage in a spot o' tic-tac-toe!

files.body:
package tictactoe

import (
	"testing"

	"gno.land/p/nt/testutils"
	"gno.land/p/nt/uassert"
)

var (
	addr1 = testutils.TestAddress("addr1")
	addr2 = testutils.TestAddress("addr2")
	addr3 = testutils.TestAddress("addr3")
)

func TestGame(t *testing.T) {
	game, err := NewGame(addr1, addr1)
	uassert.Error(t, err)

	game, err = NewGame(addr2, addr3)
	uassert.NoError(t, err)

	uassert.False(t, game.IsOver())
	uassert.False(t, game.IsDraw())
	game.Start()
	uassert.Error(t, game.Play(addr3, 0, 0))   // addr2's turn
	uassert.Error(t, game.Play(addr2, -1, 0))  // invalid location
	uassert.Error(t, game.Play(addr2, 3, 0))   // invalid location
	uassert.Error(t, game.Play(addr2, 0, -1))  // invalid location
	uassert.Error(t, game.Play(addr2, 0, 3))   // invalid location
	uassert.NoError(t, game.Play(addr2, 1, 1)) // first move
	uassert.Error(t, game.Play(addr2, 2, 2))   // addr3's turn
	uassert.Error(t, game.Play(addr3, 1, 1))   // slot already used
	uassert.NoError(t, game.Play(addr3, 0, 0)) // second move
	uassert.NoError(t, game.Play(addr2, 1, 2)) // third move
	uassert.NoError(t, game.Play(addr3, 0, 1)) // fourth move
	uassert.False(t, game.IsOver())
	uassert.NoError(t, game.Play(addr2, 1, 0)) // fifth move (win)
	uassert.True(t, game.IsOver())
	uassert.False(t, game.IsDraw())

	expected := `-O-
XO-
XO-
`
	got := game.Output()
	uassert.Equal(t, expected, got)
}

func TestRecoverGame(t *testing.T) {
	for _, o := range []struct {
		repr, err string
	}{
		{"", "error"},
		{"--", "error"},
		{"---", "error"},
		{"-----", "error"},
		{"--------", "error"},
		{"---------", ""},
		{"XX-------", "error"},
		{"OO-------", "error"},
		{"XO-X-----", "error"}, // O plays first
		{"XO-O-----", ""},      // valid from there on
		{"XOXO-----", ""},
		{"XOXOO----", ""},
		{"XOXOO-X--", ""},
		{"XOXOOOX--", ""}, // circles won but the function doesn't care
		{"XOXOOOX-X", ""},
		{"XOXOOOXOX", ""},       // circles won a second time
		{"XOXOOOXOXX", "error"}, // too long (10 squares)
	} {
		g, e := RecoverGame(addr1, addr2, o.repr)
		if o.err == "error" {
			uassert.Error(t, e, "repr=", o.repr)
		} else {
			uassert.NoError(t, e, "repr=", o.repr)
			uassert.True(t, g != nil, "repr=", o.repr)
		}
	}
}

files.body:
# Underwater Minesweeper

The goal of the game is to **uncover all squares that are not mines**.

Numbers indicate how many adjacent mines are to that tile.

Note: In this version, you can't flag squares, you will have to use your memory.

The little animals üê†, ü¶ê, ü¶à, üê≥ are protagonists from the ocean but play no part.

## Context

This demo is part of a series of mini-games for GNO, and may or may not be used for Games of Realm.

- GNO is interpreted by the validators on the gno.land chain
- no JS
- no wallet
- client renders Markdown with HTML and CSS

### Developer opinion: bring querystring!

Since no `<form method=GET>` can be used at the moment, because
only realm path is read, not the querystring, 

- each button has to be a `<a>` tag (we put some make up using CSS)...
- ...And the state of the game *has* to be repeated for each tile (each `<a>` contains a state of the game). 
    - If querystring was enabled on gnoweb, with `<form method=GET>` we could just have a **single** `<input type=hidden name=state value=xxxxxxxxxxxxx>`.

- Not only that:
  - ** `<form>` could help introduce micro transitory state** on a webpage, without JS:
  - you could use radio buttons or `<select>` menu that you style. 
  - imagine a **collective pixel-art** wall,
  - you could to choose the color of a pixel you want to paint, 
  - then paint it on the pixel-art wall.
  - as soon as you would click a pixel, it sends you to the realms helper page.

# GnopenSea - NFT Marketplace

Decentralized NFT marketplace on Gno.land with DAO governance.

## üöÄ How to list your NFT in 3 steps

### Step 1: Register your collection

**From your NFT package**, call the `Register()` function:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/[your-username]/[your-nft]" \
  -func "Register" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "staging" \
  your-wallet
```

This registers your collection in the **Registry DAO** (status: unverified).

### Step 2: Approve the marketplace

Give permission to the marketplace to transfer your NFTs:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/[your-username]/[your-nft]" \
  -func "SetApprovalForAll" \
  -args "g1[marketplace-address]" \
  -args "true" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  your-wallet
```

### Step 3: Create your listing

List your NFT for sale:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "CreateListing" \
  -args "gno.land/r/[your-username]/[your-nft]" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "5000000" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  your-wallet
```

**Parameters:**
- 1st arg: Your NFT package address
- 2nd arg: Token ID to sell
- 3rd arg: Price in ugnot (5000000 = 5 GNOT)

---

## üõí Buy an NFT

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "BuyNFT" \
  -args "1" \
  -send "5000000ugnot" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  your-wallet
```

---

## üìã Manage your listings

### Update price

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "UpdatePrice" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "10000000" \
  -broadcast \
  your-wallet
```

### Cancel a listing

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "CancelListing" \
  -args "1" \
  -broadcast \
  your-wallet
```

---

## Get your collection verified (verified badge)

### 1. Create a proposal to the Registry DAO

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4" \
  -func "ProposeVerifyCollection" \
  -args "g1[your-nft-address]" \
  -args "Collection name" \
  -args "Verification reason" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  your-wallet
```

### 2. DAO members vote

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4" \
  -func "VoteRegistry" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "yes" \
  -broadcast \
  dao-member-wallet
```

### 3. Execute the proposal (after quorum)

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4" \
  -func "TallyRegistryProposal" \
  -args "1" \
  -broadcast \
  your-wallet
```

---

## üí∞ Payment Distribution

Example with 2.5% marketplace fee and 10% royalties:

```
Sale price: 100 GNOT
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Marketplace fee (2.5%): 2.5 GNOT
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Creator royalties (10%): 10 GNOT
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Seller receives: 87.5 GNOT
```

---

## üèõÔ∏è DAO Governance

The marketplace is governed by a DAO. Members can create proposals to:

- ‚úÖ Approve/remove collections
- ‚úÖ Modify marketplace fees
- ‚úÖ Withdraw funds from treasury
- ‚úÖ Cancel problematic listings

### Create a proposal (example: update fees)

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "ProposeUpdateFees" \
  -args "300" \
  -args "Reduce fees to 3%" \
  -broadcast \
  dao-member-wallet
```

### Vote on a proposal

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "Vote" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "yes" \
  -broadcast \
  dao-member-wallet
```

---

## üîß Minimal NFT Configuration

Your NFT package must have a `Register()` function:

```go
package mynft

import (
    "gno.land/p/demo/tokens/grc721"
    "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4"
)

var (
    nft         *grc721.basicNFT
    myRealmAddr = runtime.CurrentRealm().Address()
)

func init() {
    nft = grc721.NewBasicNFT("My Collection", "MC")
}

// Register in the registry
func Register(_ realm) {
    daoregistry4.RegisterCollection(
        myRealmAddr,
        "My Collection",
        "MC",
        "art",
        "My collection description",
        "https://my-site.com",
        false,
        nft.Getter(),
    )
}

// Required function for the marketplace
func Getter() grc721.NFTGetter {
    return nft.Getter()
}
```

---

## üìä Read Functions

```bash
# View all active listings
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao:

# Marketplace statistics
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao:stats

# Listing details
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao:listing/1

# Registered collections
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4:
```

---

## üîê Security

- ‚úÖ Ownership verification before listing
- ‚úÖ Approval verification before sale
- ‚úÖ Atomic transfers
- ‚úÖ Automatic refund of excess payment
- ‚úÖ Fee limits (max 10%)
- ‚úÖ Decentralized governance

---

## üÜò Common Issues

**"Collection not registered"**
‚Üí You must first call `Register()` on your NFT

**"Insufficient payment"**
‚Üí The amount sent must match the listing price

**"Not approved"**
‚Üí Call `SetApprovalForAll()` before creating a listing

**"Not owner"**
‚Üí Only the NFT owner can list it

README.md
files.body:
# GnopenSea - NFT Marketplace

Decentralized NFT marketplace on Gno.land with DAO governance.

## üöÄ How to list your NFT in 3 steps

### Step 1: Register your collection

**From your NFT package**, call the `Register()` function:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/[your-username]/[your-nft]" \
  -func "Register" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "staging" \
  your-wallet
```

This registers your collection in the **Registry DAO** (status: unverified).

### Step 2: Approve the marketplace

Give permission to the marketplace to transfer your NFTs:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/[your-username]/[your-nft]" \
  -func "SetApprovalForAll" \
  -args "g1[marketplace-address]" \
  -args "true" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  your-wallet
```

### Step 3: Create your listing

List your NFT for sale:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "CreateListing" \
  -args "gno.land/r/[your-username]/[your-nft]" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "5000000" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  your-wallet
```

**Parameters:**
- 1st arg: Your NFT package address
- 2nd arg: Token ID to sell
- 3rd arg: Price in ugnot (5000000 = 5 GNOT)

---

## üõí Buy an NFT

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "BuyNFT" \
  -args "1" \
  -send "5000000ugnot" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  your-wallet
```

---

## üìã Manage your listings

### Update price

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "UpdatePrice" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "10000000" \
  -broadcast \
  your-wallet
```

### Cancel a listing

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "CancelListing" \
  -args "1" \
  -broadcast \
  your-wallet
```

---

## Get your collection verified (verified badge)

### 1. Create a proposal to the Registry DAO

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4" \
  -func "ProposeVerifyCollection" \
  -args "g1[your-nft-address]" \
  -args "Collection name" \
  -args "Verification reason" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  your-wallet
```

### 2. DAO members vote

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4" \
  -func "VoteRegistry" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "yes" \
  -broadcast \
  dao-member-wallet
```

### 3. Execute the proposal (after quorum)

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4" \
  -func "TallyRegistryProposal" \
  -args "1" \
  -broadcast \
  your-wallet
```

---

## üí∞ Payment Distribution

Example with 2.5% marketplace fee and 10% royalties:

```
Sale price: 100 GNOT
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Marketplace fee (2.5%): 2.5 GNOT
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Creator royalties (10%): 10 GNOT
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Seller receives: 87.5 GNOT
```
